page.title: 20LOCAL DIALECT
page.content:
The South Pembrokeshire dialect is going out of use.The language used on television and radio is replacing many of the old local words.The following Pembrokeshire words are still used in our block,though mostly by older people.
WHY AYE (yes) BOY(a male of any age) CAFFLED (tangled up) DYSEL (thistle) A FOX (a fine day in the middle of a long spell of bad weather). HOBBLE (a job done for somebody usually without telling D.H.S.S. or the Taxman). A MASTERPIECE (something done to a high standard). PENNYSOW(a woodlouse) PILE(to throw e.g.'to pile stones').LAKE (a stream) THE TIDE (the sea)(Rosemarket people use this to mean Westfield Pill).
